---
title: "Persistent Identifiers (PIDs)"
---

## Research Outputs

-   Use of PIDs (e.g., DOI, Handle, ARK) to uniquely identify outputs.

## Formats and Standards

-   PIDs for metadata schemas and standards.

## Access

-   PIDs for access protocols and repositories.

## Data Management

-   PIDs for datasets and related documentation.

Example PIDs:

-   [ORCID](https://orcid.org) - person PIDs

-   [ROR](https://ror.org) - research organization PIDs

-   [Re3data](https://www.re3data.org) - specifically PIDs for data repositories

-   Funding Award Numbers

-   [RAID](https://raid.org) - project meta-PID

-   [RRID](https://www.rrids.org)

-   [DataCite (DOIs)](https://datacite.org)

::: callout-tip
